title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 33.6 - Grouping of loans
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 33.6 - Grouping of loans

State Regulations

If a lending institution adjusts the rate of interest charged
on loans on common adjustment dates (such as the first day of January, April, July and October, or less frequently) rather than adjusting the rate of
interest on an individual quarterly (or less frequent) interval measured from
the date of the loan, the lending institution may on any common adjustment date
increase the rate of interest charged on a loan made within 25 days before that
common adjustment date only if prior to the consummation of the loan the
lending institution provides notice of the increase and the new rate of
interest to the person who is to be primarily liable on the loan. In no case
may the rate be adjusted more than once within any three-month
period. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3
ยง
33.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
